com.isoterik.mgdx.ai.fsm

Class Transition<S extends com.badlogic.gdx.ai.fsm.State<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.isoterik.mgdx.ai.fsm.Transition<S>
  • Type Parameters:
    S - the type of State that will be transitioned.

    public class Transition<S extends com.badlogic.gdx.ai.fsm.State<?>>
extends java.lang.Object
    A Transition is used by ManagedStateMachine to change state. It uses one or more IConditions to determine when the change should happen. A transition will only take place when all the available IConditions evaluates to true
    See Also:
    ManagedStateMachine, ICondition, State

    • Constructor Detail

      • Transition

        public Transition(S fromState,
                  S toState,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<ICondition> conditions)
        Creates a new instance with the states to transition between and an Array of conditions.
        Parameters:
        fromState - the state to transition from. Can be null. If it is null, transition will be from any state.
        toState - the state to transition to.
        conditions - an array of conditions for this transition to take effect

      • Transition

        public Transition(S fromState,
                  S toState,
                  ICondition... conditions)
        Creates a new instance with the states to transition between and zero or more conditions. Note: no transition will occur if no condition is provided. Conditions can always be added later after construction.
        Parameters:
        fromState - the state to transition from. Can be null. If it is null, transition will be from any state.
        toState - the state to transition to.
        conditions - zero or more conditions

      • Transition

        public Transition(S toState,
                  com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<ICondition> conditions)
        Creates a new instance with a state to transition to and an Array of conditions. This will effectively transition from any state until a fromState is set!
        Parameters:
        toState - the state to transition to.
        conditions - an array of conditions for this transition to take effect

      • Transition

        public Transition(S toState,
                  ICondition... conditions)
        Creates a new instance with a state to transition to and zero or more conditions. This will effectively transition from any state until a fromState is set! Note: no transition will occur if no condition is provided. Conditions can always be added later after construction.
        Parameters:
        toState - the state to transition to.
        conditions - zero or more conditions

      • invert

        public Transition<S> invert()
        Creates a new instance capable of doing the exact opposite of what the current instance does. This is useful for creating bi-directional transitions. For example: if this instance represents a transition from StateA to StateB, calling this method returns a new instance that transition from StateB back to StateA. Note:
        • The returned instance represents a reversed copy of the current instance at the moment when this method is called. Subsequent changes to the original instance will have no effect on the returned instance.
        • The conditions are also reversed!
        Returns:
        a new instance that reverses the behavior of the current instance

      • invert

        public Transition<S> invert(S toState)
        Creates a new instance that will transition back to the given transition instance from any state. This is useful for creating bi-directional transitions for instances that have no valid fromState(ie. it is a transition from any state). Note:
        • The returned instance represents a reversed copy of the current instance at the moment when this method is called. Subsequent changes to the original instance will have no effect on the returned instance.
        • The conditions are also reversed!
        Parameters:
        toState - the state to transition to.
        Returns:
        a new instance that reverses the behavior of the current instance

      • isTriggered

        public boolean isTriggered()
        Determines whether this transition should take effect or not.
        Returns:
        true if all the conditions are met, false otherwise
